    Identify and Interpret the Message

    Figure 1

    Image 1 of 1: ‘Pie chart of the abundance of canids are fox or coyote’

    {On average across North America throughout the collection period foxes made up 80?% and Coyotes made up 20% of the canids}

    Figure 2

    Image 1 of 1: ‘Graph of Fox populations before and after Jan 1, 1970’

    What is the message of this graph?
    {Fox populations before Jan 1, 1970 were greater than after 1970 {North American fox populations averaged 3765 (units) prior to Jan. 1, 1970 and 2062 after.} Discuss message as a group

    Figure 3

    Image 1 of 1: ‘Graph of Fox populations before and after Jan 1, 1970’

    What is the message of this graph?
    {Coyote populations in Maine ranged from zero to 2741 throughout the collections period and had a median of 1393 and mean of 1296 units.} Discuss message as a group

    Figure 4

    Image 1 of 1: ‘Scatterplot of fox and coyote populations’

    What is the message of this graph?
    {Fox populations tended to decrease as Coyote populations increased} Discuss message as a group

    Figure 5

    Image 1 of 1: ‘The chart chooser graphic is an informative tool to help you consider what chart types are appropriate for your data and message.’
